text: hi! love this product it was my first time buying it so i'm happy and i get so happy seeing it in my bathroom :)what i was scared of and something i heard a lot about buying this product thru amazon is the color of the product being yellow-tinged. people were saying that these products were tampered with and fake. this is not true. they're not fake. the actual company addressed this issue and just says it's because of the ingredients and that we can check the product for expiration dates. even tho the color is yellow-tinged does not mean it is expired, it is just not fresh out the factory and most likely what they pull from the shelves for customer satisfaction and why we are able to get this product at a lower price.for the tampering, im not sure. there is no factory seal. i took off one star because my product was leaking and the entire individual skii package was wet :( that's precious $$ wasted. however, my skin feels great yay

text: SKII Essence is pricy but worth every penny. Since I started using it my skin has improved immensely. As a test, I swiped it on my left arm - the one with the most age-related brown spots because I drive a lot - while leaving my right arm untouched. I couldn’t believe the difference after a few months of use, and after a year the spots in my left arm were nearly imperceptible. I have the larger bottle and it lasts me a year of daily use so I think there is very good value in this product. I can’t imagine ever not having SKII Essence in my daily regimen.

I hate when I look at my face and I can tell I'm wearing foundation...this avoids that completely!  the SPF is a huge bonus.  Also, I have very acne prone skin and this does NOT break me out.

text: I can't express how much I love this product. BareMinerals has always been a sort of hit and miss for me. This product exceeded all of my expectations, it's actually the first makeup that I buy back-ups of. I have fairly persistent acne problems (I'm 25), it has always been an issue finding a product that I can wear to look like I gave a crap about myself without looking like I was covered in makeup (light but durable coverage has always been an issue). One of my friends recommended it to me, well went passed recommending and was raving about how amazing it is. I was happy to comply, she has flawless skin. I rarely wear actual foundation, concealer, or powder anymore, unless I'm going out somewhere I've got to tart myself up a bit. I noticed a change in my bare facial complexion within days. My skin brightened up, my acne is pretty much eliminated (has no alcohol, benzo, other acne treatments in it), and my skin was noticeably soft and hydrated. Initially when I first began wearing it, I would use two layers (because of my acne), I now use what I would consider about half of a layer, very minimal coverage. For longer wear, I recommend adding an extra layer than you usually would. Something I really love about it is when you put it on, it has a kind of cooling feeling, and with this less really is more as far as application goes. When layering, allow to completely absorb into skin before applying an extra layer (for longer wear). Or you can always totally just touch up later, I just usually never have time once I'm out the door to get near a mirror or sneak off for a couple of minutes. I was able to hydrate my skin (had to day/night because of my acne treatments that would dry out my skin), without having to use daily moisturizer. I know it is a little pricey, the product on here is actually less than BareMinerals the last time I checked, but if you want to give it a shot and decide that it isn't quite the product for you, I highly recommend keeping it on hand and using it for beach days or situations like that when you may want a lighter coverage that has SPF included. When the product first launched, they hand't released a full range of colors yet. If you're unsure if this is the right shade for you, I recommend visiting the BareMinerals website, they have a color chart. I went on there and then just came on here and searched for the specific shade I was matched with there. Last I checked in, they have at least 25 listed. One last thing worth mentioning, I don't wear mine with powder, but the friend that recommended it does her entire facial makeup routine (blush, translucent powder) with hers and it looks great still.

text: At $74, for 6 small items, this was a pretty expensive purchase. But I wanted to try the Drunk Elephant products since I heard such high praise about them, and this was a good way to try out several products before I invest in an expensive bottle of any of these.Well, once again I was taught a lesson of leaving something for later. Three months after my purchase, I tried to day serum and nothing came out. I was puzzled but let it go, and used the other bottles. Today I finally broke it open to see what's going on-- I thought it was just not pumping right-- and all I found was a bit of dry white powder at the bottom. The entire bottle dried up.Thankfully, the others did work and I can say that I do like them, although I'm not entirely sure why they'd be superior to other, less expensive, organic products. It's probably due to high quality ingredients but still, the price is way up there. The face cream is pleasant and smooth, as is the night serum. The oil helped me quite a bit when my skin was flaking due to exfoliation serums. I didn't try the foundation since I don't use such products but I'll see if I can add it to a powdered face mask (I think that would work-- need to find out.) What else? Oh, the scrub gel. It seems gentle enough when my skin is being sensitive (again, due to trying exfoliating serums.)Overall... hmm. If I was rich I guess I'd purchase this due to the high quality ingredients. But I don't have extra money to spend on a bit of serum and cream that's gone quickly. You CAN use small amounts so it doesn't vanish quickly, but still. I may purchase the scrub gel since it seems gentle-- the others I may need to leave for later, if ever.
title: Expensive-- and the day serum dried up so was unable to use it

text: Shipping wasn’t that fast but that don’t matter. Drunk elephant is a okay brand, stuff a little over priced and the things are functional. My lil moisturizer felt cool and great however came with scratch’s and scuffs on the container. Not to mention there was like a big air bubble in it meaning I got less of the amount ;-;. Bag was cool but also had scuffs. The orange one, yes I forgot wut it was called irritated my skin a little but was alright I guess. Everything else worked fine but nothing about this kit really stand out. I never really had acne unless I ate unhealthy stuff the other day but I got acne soon after idk if it was the exams or another product I was using but I still have it to this time I’m writing this review. Drunk elephant is just expensive looks ay okay and meh normal i guess. Not awful but it’s nothing special. Kit was cool and gave me a feel of their products with me intro into skincare. Definitely could be better for like wut 72 dollars? Anyways try or don’t try hope this helps!! :)

text: Product arrived earlier than expected, and in perfect condition. This SKII Essence has been A HG(Holy Grail) product that I have been using for for several years, but this is the first time I have ordered it from Amazon. Upon arrival, I inspected the bottle/ packaging. I've always purchased the set, because it's about the same price as the single bottle, so the box was different from what I typically use. The bottle looks exactly the same. I checked for the seal and it was there. I've been using it ,and I haven't noticed anything different in the quality, smell, texture ect. that I noticed another review mentioned. I double cleanse, Then I apply an AHA Toner. After that, I apply This SKII Essence with my fingertips, because at this price point I don't want to loose a single drop on a cotton pad. Then I apply my Serum and lotion on top. I was out of the essence for a bit before I ordered it this time, and I noticed a difference. Without daily use of this product,my face became really dry and dull. Now my face is Happy again! Thanks Amazon!
title: My Face is Happy Again!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2023

text: Had a free sample of this at some point. It must have been older because they slightly changed the name when I went to buy it. I’ve tried about a dozen moisturizers and this is the only one I get consistent results from. It’s thick so I usually wet my face before. It spreads well and has a little fragrance to it but nothing overbearing. I can feel it all day. It’s definitely on the heavier side but I don’t mind for the hydrating effects. Solid cream, highly recommend.

text: i have been on quite the skin care journey. i’ve always struggled with dry & dehydrated skin and have never been able to find the perfect moisturizer. i came across Laneige and decided to give it a try. after the first use of this product, i fell in love. i have sensitive, acne prone skin and was worried that this would cause my skin to flare up. but it didn’t. not to mention, this is a lot more affordable than a lot of the high-end skin care brands out there. i also use the eye cream, toner, hyaluronic acid, lip sleeping mask & lip balm. i know everyone’s skin is different and unique, but this is def worth giving a try.

text: LOVE this face moisturizer. First off I’ve had issues with my skin being extremely dry to the point it feels tight (painful!), flaky, and also can get a little red and flat out irritated. I have to say I absolutely normally hate the feeling of lotion. This is amazing though, especially using it after I shower. A little but goes a long way as it is a heavy moisturizer. It soaks right into my skin and leaves it feeling soft as a baby’s bottom, and as time goes on using it more and more I’ve noticed it seems to even out my skin tone and help with redness as well. It comes in a pretty glass jar which I love. The ONLY downside is the price. I don’t use many beauty products though, but this is one of those items I splurge on to treat myself, and will continue to! I also started using the glow oil and adding that has made my skin feel even softer/smoother, and look even more radiant. I feel so much better with these products and I don’t even wear foundation anymore! Overall they make my feel amazing and more confident. Worth every penny!
title: Makes my dry skin so silky soft, evens skin tone.

(No yours isn't fake, I've used this brand for a while, all of their stuff doesn't come in plastic sealing and it's really annoying)-However, the actual glass bottle that alot of these ship in is top tier quality. (I wouldn't recommend this) but I've dropped this and the face wash multiple times and only had 1 situation where it cracked.-To YTTP.....PLEASE ship your stuff in some sort of tamper proof packaging with a wrap. text: I received a sample via a sample subscription service called IPSY and Loved it! I have very sensitive and complicated skin. It can be super dry and flaky around my chin, mouth, nose, and cheeks, but the T zone (I think that's what it's called - nose bridge and forehead), are always super oily no matter what I use. With this product as much as it ate at me to spend $58 for it, the jar is actually bigger than I would have guessed 2 ounces to be. It's about the size of a bottle of Pepto Bismol 12oz bottle in circumference and half the height of the Pepto bottle.Usually I refuse to spend a lot of money on any kind of product unless I can justify it and this is one that as hard as it felt to justify it, I had to spend it. It will last me a very long time using just a bit once a day. The sample was barely 0.2ounces and it has lasted me 2-3 months. I definitely recommend this product to everyone including my own teenage kids!

I first bought this moisturizer from YTTP directly and then realized it was on Amazon and purchased my second one on Amazon. I must say I would rather purchase it directly from YTTP because packaging and handling is so much better. Amazon packaging is thrown in envelope and comes in damaged. Thankfully the moisturizer is in a box container which was damaged and but did secure glass moisturizer to arrive okay. The moisturizer was not sealed either. YTTP are really great products and I highly recommend. I also have the Superberry mask cream and just ordered the whipped cream.

text: I am in my mid-sixties with mature skin and previously tended to have dry skin.  Unfortunately, in my youth there was this myth that skin-care oil was not healthy for facial skin.  The best lines of cosmetics were touted as superior because they were oil free.  I spent most of my adult life tolerating dry skin, and wasting money on moisturizers and other skin products that were encumbered with chemicals, parabens, and different preservatives.  Some of these products would occasionally irritate my skin.  Lifelong myths are had to dismiss, but this year I had decided to broaden my horizons concerning skin care products and started experimenting with different oils for my beauty care routine.  This has opened up a brand new realm.  I have now bought and used the following facial oils; Almond, Argan, Avocado, Castor, Olive, Walnut and Vitamin E and all of these oils have worked well.  However, Fresh Seaberry Moisturizing Face Oil has provided my skin with the most Remarkable, Dramatic and Effective results of all.The Seaberry Oil uses an eyedropper dispenser vial that reaches all the way to the very bottom of the bottle, so there will not be any waste, unlike most dispenser vials, that only reach down about 80%.The fragrance is unique, I am unable to explain it, an earthy clean scent, something like the fresh smell of the earth after a drenching spring rain.  I really like it; I find it calming instead of the sweet floral or fruity scents that I am used to in many other skin care products.I have been using Seaberry Oil for about five weeks and I use it twice daily, in the mornings; first my vitamin c serum, HA (hyaluronic acid), and then the Seaberry Oil.  I only need 3 – 4 drops for both my face and neck, and my skin absorbs this lightweight oil immediately.  Then in the evenings; first I use my derma roller, followed by my vitamin c serum, the HA, and finish off with a few drops of Seaberry Oil.  The Seaberry Oil soothes, calms, and augments the healing process after the derma roll session, with a much-needed increase of moisture.After five weeks usage of the Seaberry Oil, these are my results in conjunction with the derma roll sessions, vitamin c serum, and HA.  My skin tone and texture is much smoother, softer and my facial skin is noticeably firmer.I now use very little make-up, as I no longer feel the necessity to cover-up my skin with foundation.  After my sunscreen, I only require a touch of blush or bronzer, eyeliner, mascara and lip-gloss.  Fresh Seaberry Moisturizing Oil keeps my face soft, supple, hydrated, and moisturized, providing dewy fresh naturalness without any shiny residue.  I will continue with my other oils as they have extraordinary benefits for my body and my hair, but when it comes to facial moisturizing oils, Seaberry Oil is now my number #1!
title: My Favorite Face Oil…I now look Better WITHOUT Make-Up !
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2014

text: This product has made a significant difference in my skin, and believe me I've used many different anti-aging products over the years.  Fresh has a few that I really like, but their Seaberry Moisturizng Face Oil is hands down the best.  I have had so many people compliment me and ask me what I'm doing different, and I tell them about this.  Many don't accept the idea of an oil being used as a moisturizer, particularly if they have oily skin.  The thing is, this oil will not make you break out, and it even heals breakouts, besides re-surfacing facial wrinkles and giving a healthy glow.  It feels so good on my face, I use it twice a day.  In the year or so since I began using it, the difference is remarkable.  I would recommend it to anyone.

The oil is a beautiful blend of pure oils, feels wonderful and nourishing on the skin and absorbs quickly. My skin definitely feels more hydrated when I use this oil. I some times use it on my neck, hands, and elbows if my skin feels particularly dry.  Unlike some of the other reviewers, I love the scent because it's very natural and somewhat nutty. I really don't like all the perfumes used in most skin care products, so I find the scent of this one very natural and pleasing.

text: I've only been using this product for a few months, but I am so glad I came across it. I put this on after my moisturizer, and it adds such a beautiful glow to the face– hence the name 'Glow Oil'. I find the best way to apply it is to gently tap the product into the skin. I'm not a big makeup person, so I do not know how well this works with foundations, concealers, etc. I typically follow the oil with Elta MD Tinted Moisturizer SPF 40, and am very pleased with the results.

text: The scent is light and refreshing. I use this at night with my other Belif products. I apply the aqua bomb all over my face and neck then the Belif moisturizing eye bomb under my eyes as well as on top of my eyelids. I finish off with the aqua bomb night mask on top. In the morning I rinse it all off and it leaves my skin feeling so soft. I then use the Belif moisturizing bomb on my face in the morning and apply my makeup on top. I’ve been using this skincare routine for 1 month now I’ve noticed less lines on my forehead and softer skin. I have an average skin type and had slightly dry skin patches by my chin and cheek which are gone now. I highly recommend this brands products.

text: I really like this mask! It's ultra hydrating, the texture is so interesting...like jello almost! Jelly enough that it scoops out, but then it reconforms in the jar  once you do. As an esthetician I don't love skincare with fragrances because I don't feel that it's good for your skin, but I still decided to get this and it does smell amazing...kind of refreshing like fruit punch or something. It feels wonderful going on, super hydrating and it spreads well. Once it's on it sort of dries in and you don't feel sticky, yet you can still tell there's a layer of moisture on your face and it's working. All in all I really like it, good buy!

text: The OleHenriksen Invigortating Night Transformation Gel arrived in a warped product box that looked aged & missing the paint on the box corners & edges,- like had been stored in a sunny window or had gotten wet & dried out.  There was no mfg. seal on the box.  It looked so bad that I called customer service at OleHenriksen website to see if it was still a current product that THEY sell.  Their rep checked & had no rcd of that product in their inventory.  No telling how old the product is, if the actual mfg. website doesnt even show it.  So,  I didnt want to put it on my face, but tried it out on hands, below my neck,(to see if over the time from date of rcpt) trying to be fair. Sometimes if isnt too old,- still may be good,  but I think whatever shelf life this had, it has expired.  I had no idea this was old product when I ordered, because I had only been using OleHenriksen products for a few weeks prior to my order & had purchased them from a different seller.  To say the least,- I was shocked to see this item when I opened my delivery.I dont think this seller should have even offered it for sale, much less, gone ahead & shipped it.

text: I originally tried this product in a sample size.  It was gentle and non-irritating. It moisturizes and calms. I decided it was worth the price of the full size.  One only needs about a teaspoon in the palm of the hand to pat on the  face. It is like a toner and is a great first step after cleansing.  I have been very pleased with Tatcha's products.It arrived quickly and was packaged well.

text: It’s very full- feeling but not too think or thin, it has almost a cooling affect. not sure why so many are complaining about the smell, it honestly just smells like it has a natural fresh plant ish, wax smell but in a good way and it’s not strong what so ever. It just melts into your skin and it’s not oily at all and leaves ur skin immediately hydrated with a glow and a little goes a long way. I have very dry, acne prone skin and lancers method is the only thing that truly had a visual affect on it. This moisturizer is a must and you get what you pay for, it’s very high end. I own the “dehydrated sensitive-skin” one and also the “normal to combination” and the normal one has more of a fresh, dove soap smell that is also not strong but I found that the sensitive skin one was a lot more hydrating. If you also struggle with acne, dry skin or even fine lines or dull skin I would very highly recommend lancers Caviar lime acid peel, it’s $75 here on Amazon. It’s a  moisturizer type face mask that you leave on for 15 mins and rinse, you do so twice a week it’s literally one of my favorite skincare products!

text: I love the results of this product. It makes my face feel amazing and soft. if you are very picky do not buy from amazon because the product is not sealed but the product is great, and it works just as well as the one you will pay $39 sealed from DS. I did not notice anything wrong with product, smell or texture ( And I'm picky about that). Product works and for the price I do not mind there is not seal on it. I am guessing is a promo from Clinique and they are reselling. I don't think that matters, at least for me. I rather save money and have the same great results.

text: I really like this, even my boyfriend uses it. It's perfect for this cold winter weather, and a little goes a very long way, so be careful about how much you use because too much will leave you greasy. For instance, I think a pea sized amount might be too much on my face, but my skin is pretty well moisturized for the most part so if you're dryer a pea size might be just right for you. Still, always a good idea to start with a little and build up to avoid wasting product. I use this mainly on the areas I'm concerned about wrinkles forming or that are a bit dry (I have combo skin) like my forhead, brow, laugh lines, lips and nose, then apply my regular moisturizer on top. I also use it as a night time neck cream and on itchy, dry legs and it helped greatly. All in all, very good product at a good price point, especially for the amount you get. This tube might actually expire before I can use it all. I'd recommend to just about anyone.

I have oily skin and even tho I'm almost 30 still get acne (sigh). I kinda switch out Cerave products with FAB and micellar water as a se one cleanser and man it really works for me. I feel really bad for the people who say it stings I know how that feels and it sucks. Idk what makes some products do that for some people and not for others?Anyway...I liked their ultra relief cream but even that felt like a little heavy for me. I’m not going to lie, at first it felt great and it definitely felt like my skin was absorbing the product. Fast forward to a week or two after using this, my skin started to bump up a lot around my cheeks and mouth, this had never happened previous to me using this cream. I took a break from it and noticed the bumps were starting to heal and go down a bit, then I used it again and the bumps came back even more irritated. I started breaking out a bit too. text: I don’t think this is Coconut Water Cream! I have used over 15 jars of this so I know the product incredibly well. I usually purchase directly from the FAB website or at Sephora and Ulta stores, but decided to try buying on Amazon for convenience. Overall, the smell was slightly off where it was overbearingly sweet and sugary rather then a hint of coconut. When applied it felt very waxy and thick and sat on my skin. It also needed to be rubbed and worked in instead of the usual water and lightweight texture that soaks in right away. The biggest giveaway was when the product dried down, it began to flake and pill like never before. I basically had to wet my hands and massage it back into my skin so it could set correctly. Either they changed the formula or I was given a fake or old product. Just to be safe, I recommend to buy in-store instead of through Amazon!

text: So far I think I like this, though if you don’t slowly build your skin up to tolerate this harsher treatment, it can cause pain, stinging, redness and irritation. That said, I do believe this is helpful for a lot of skin issues.I think my skin is a little drier, so I’m working on finding the right combo of moisturizers and proper steps to help remedy this.IMPORTANT NOTE: Be careful not to mix certain other skincare products or ingredients with it (no matter what the website may say!).To be helpful, I have made a list of things NOT to mix at the same time and important tips.However, to be sure, ask a professional dermatologist:•DO NOT MIX:-RETINOL should not be mixed with: Vitamin C, Vitamin E, AHA/BHA or Benzol Peroxide.-AHA/BHA should not be mixed with: Retinol, Vitamin C or Niacinamide (and possibly peptides but I am not 100% sure on that).-VITAMIN C should not be mixed with Retinol, AHA/BHA or Niacinamide.-VITAMIN E should not be mixed with Retinol.-NIACINAMIDE should not be mixed with AHA/BHA or Vitamin C-BENZOYL PEROXIDE should not be mixed with Retinol.NOTE: Both Retinol and AHA/BHA can be very helpful for various skin issues. While you should not MIX them, you can switch between them (example: Monday for Retinol, Tuesday for AHA/BHA, etc) nightly once your skin has been safely worked up to tolerating these more intense skin remedies. Do not try to do this all at once, right off the bat.•SUN AND CARE:-While the Drunk Elephant website doesn’t always address this, in most cases RETINOL and AHA/BHA should be used at night as they cause sensitivity to the sun that can damage skin. I don’t know if applying sunscreen will fully keep your skin safe (not to mention all the reapplying). While you *may* be able to use it if you’re staying indoors, do understand that harmful rays can enter the home, car and workplace through windows. If you’re going to experience sun, regardless of what you do or do not put on your skin, an SPF of at least 30 should be an everyday routine (with reapplying).As for if you stay indoors, away from windows, one would assume hanging out in a dark room all day would suffice, but I’m no expert.-So it’s beat to use Retinol and AHA/BHA at night and wash it off in the morning. A cream or serum containing Vitamin C thrives off sunlight, so that is best to use in the daytime.•IF YOU OVERDO THE SKIN TREATMENTS AND YOUR SKIN IS FEELING DRY OR IRRITATED: Take a break from the harsh products and use very gentle ones for a little bit. Particularly CERAMIDES. These are gentle and help your skin to heal, calm and moisturize your skin. I personally have used (and liked) “Good Cera Super Ceramide Emulsion (pH 5.5 / 7 free)” which is a nice, gentle moisturizer. There are also things like ceramide masks that can help.
title: So Far, So Good (& info on what  not to mix & how to fix skin if irritated by products)
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020

text: Every other product containing glycolic acid I’ve tried has caused pretty immediate & extreme sensitization lasting for a few days. I thought I just couldn’t tolerate it as an ingredient until I found this. Although lactic acid always worked better for me, when it comes to DE products, I prefer Framboos over Protini.This does not cause any stinging or dryness, and although I do not recommend testing this out, it shockingly didn’t cause stinging on already-sensitized skin. It’s a nice gel texture and layers well with my other skincare products.I just need to ensure I use it in moderation and on non-retinol nights. I will have to figure out where it fits into my routine when I switch to a Tretinoin + Azelaic Acid formula (I currently use OTC Adapalene).Overall I definitely recommend it, and highly suggest getting it on Amazon vs from Sephora as it’s less than a third of the price here. (IMO it’s worth ~$30, NOT $90).For ingredient-conscious skincare junkies, this one also passes the INCIdecoder.com test — it doesn’t contain any fragrance, irritants, or comedogenic ingredients, and has a lot of “goodie”s.
title: Surprisingly gentle when used in moderation

text: I love this product!  My daughter, who has her own youtube makeup and product channel, told me about it a year or so ago.  I bought it, although I was a bit freaked out about the price.  After using it for a month or more, I could see a definite difference in my skin.  Sun spots (I have a few), blemishes (how is it fair to be over 50 and still get blemishes?), fine lines....all soothed and somehow improved by this product.  I strayed from DE for awhile, being all thrifty and thinking I could find a product which would produce similar results for fewer dollars, but I haven't.  I saw photos of myself during my Drunk Elephant days and it was decided.  My skin looked the best it has looked in 10 years or more.  Dewey and more youthful by far than prior to DE.  Though a bit pricey, mine lasts me about 3 months and the juice is most definitely worth the squeeze!(the photos are 1.(Back tip) Using DE  2. (Green top)  Not using DE for many months 3) (purple/blue print)  Using DE again! (for some reason photos post out of irder so I added clothing description).  The differences are dramatic!

text: I have been ordering this since 2017 and just checked past orders…about every 6 months. So for the price, it lasts a long time. I suspect some are using too much and maybe that is why they run out. A fully depressed squirt for each cheek is really too much. I pump it once and spread it around quickly (avoiding my eyes). Then I use a night cream by L’Oreal (cheap at the drugstore). If I get lazy and just use the night cream alone, I can tell the difference (especially when traveling, I try to get by without it). At home, I tend to use DE every night (I clean my face without fail). When I do, my skin is always very smooth. I can’t say it lightens my age spots. But my face is somewhat brighter and less sallow. I just turned 75, so every little bit helps….My updated review: I have purchased this several times on Amazon. The last time was April 2, 2023 for $33.15. I should have known better. You get what you pay for. It was a fake. I went on Drunk Elephant’s website and ordered it for $90……the real deal. Previously on Amazon I believe I got the real thing. But I paid either $90 or $88 or something similar. Wake-up if you are paying half price, you are not getting the real thing. I will now pay more attention to the who the seller is.

text: I use this face wash every day in the evening and love it. This is my second time buying it, and it still doesn’t disappoint. The powder itself melts away under the water so you feel absolutely no grittiness when washing, and the formula is gentle yet effective. I could probably do it twice a day if I really wanted to, and still have reasonable soft, moisturized skin: it’s just that gentle of the an exfoliate. Nothing has tackled my tough skin texture like this product, though.And let’s talk about the bang for your buck. I know the price point looks daunting. BUT using it once daily, I bought a bottle a couple months before my nephew was born, and he’s turning one in a couple days. I should throw it a party too, it’s still going strong. I bought another one to keep in my travel bag and nothing has changed about the product whatsoever.I have seen others complain about the bottle redesign but I have had no issues with the bottle and have always been able to get the perfect amount out without hassle. If you can afford the splurge, buy this now!

text: I know it’s getting some bad reviews but I’m impressed. It does remove dead skin just not as much as an abrasive exfoliate. I’m a landscaper and have a lot of sun damage on my face. This product is mild enough for me to use everyday if I need, can’t do that with abrasive scrubs! The beads coming off my face are dark brown, tested a white area of my skin and not brown. I definitely notice a lighter tone to my face after using this product. My skin feels softer and it eliminates a lot of oils on my skin. I have bought this product 4 times and use it like 2-3 times a week and every time before I wear makeup, which is not that often but helps prep my skin for flawless foundation. Hard to do when your skin is soooooo discolored from sun damage.

text: This product smells like citrus, and I expected this based on the description. However, it isn’t a pleasant orangey smell like REN’s glycol lactic radiance renewal mask. Instead, it smells like Goo-Gone, or citrus-based industrial cleaning agents — products that are designed to dissolve sticky, stubborn grime on nonporous surfaces, and which you would never want on your skin. I don’t mind the smell generally, but it isn’t appealing, and it feels strange to have this particular smell in a product that I’m supposed to put on my face. At least it isn’t too strong and dissipates pretty quickly.

text: I’ve been using this product since 2020 as it was recommended by Dr. Zion Ko on Instagram. I purchased some of the products that she considered ‘holy grails’ and stuck with them trying to get my acne-promed skin under control before my wedding in September 2021.  This toner does not have a strong, alcohol-stringent application.  It smells fresh, clean and prepares your skin for the subsequent facial products.  I appreciate the remaining residue that the toner removes that I can visualize on my cotton pad that my cleaner misses.  While it’s minimal minimal, it gives me the affirmation that my skin is ‘rid’ of all the makeup worn from the morning of. My complexion is brighter and my skin appears more soft.  Of all the dozen toner brands used, I’ve stuck with this the longest and continue to re-purchase when I run out.
title: BUY IT. NOW.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023

text: I'm a 16 years old guy. My mom recommended this product to me a few months ago. At first I was a little skeptic about this product since I heard that if it burns, it means the person's skin is irritated by it, which happened to me after using it for the first time. I stopped for 1 week, then decided to use it again, but that time, it was continuously and I ignored the burn. I had severe acne back then, but 3 months later, all those severe acne are gone and it's all scars now, but no more bumps/whiteheads whatsoever! My acne scars went from red to dark and is now in the process peeling off which means it is now in the exfoliating mode. I have a before and after picture of my acne but I will not post it for now. Also, it smoothed my skin out and even out the tone. Though the bad thing is that it burns and gets your face dry, so I recommend applying a non-comedogenic moisturizer such as Aveeno. But overall, this product was AMAZING (:
title: Amazing exfoliator and acne prevention!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2010

text: I've been using this Clinique product for 45 years.  I stray and always come back.  I need the exfoliating properties for blemish free, bright skin.  This does not sting or irritate my skin, but Clinique makes different formulas for different skin types.  I would recommend stopping by a store that sells Clinique and having your face analyzed the first time.  Or you could try trial and error.  This lotion is for combination oily/dry skin.  Clarifying Lotion 4 would be for very oily skin.  Clarifying Lotion 1 would be for skin that dries easily.  Incidentally, this is not a lotion in spite of the name.  It is a cleansing astringent.
title: I've used this product for 45 years!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2014

I did notice more hydration and plumpness under the eye and loved the medal ball applicator you use to apply. It brings a coolness while reducing the tugging under the eye.If money was not a problem I would repurchase but at this stage of life I am searching for an eye cream that is more of a reasonable price.

text: This retailer is great, NO leaks! I’ve used this for 2 yrs and finding this was a game changer for me. First- the fragrance, reminds me of hiking in the woods. Very earthy/like rosemary, love it. The fragrance goes away in about 2 mins. i use it in 3 ways: 1-2 times a week as a deep face cleanse (like toner) with a cotton pad, or right out of the shower generously applied to face and neck letting it soak in, and sometimes sleep in. It after washing my makeup off giving it all night to really work its magic. This gets rid of dullness in fact I notice a radiance in my BARE SKIN for days after using this if I use it 3-4 times a week. My skin is combo, very sensitive, and has rosacea. This calms breakouts, reduces redness some, and makes my skin feel firmer. In daytime I  put moisturizer or sheer tinted mineral sunscreen (Burt’s Bees BB Cream) lightly over it & they work great together. Also use in my shoulders, forearms, anywhere your skin feels dry, itchy or tight (esp in winter.) The mushrooms in it have wonderful anti-aging properties. I’ll use it forever!
title: Most soothing & non-irritating face product!l EVER
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023

text: I didn’t expect much from these pads, as I have been disappointed by products from this brand before. I bought the small package to try them out and I am so happy I did. I suffer from blackheads and these have gotten rid of 90% of them in a week, using one pad every night after washing my face. I avoid the eye area and use on the rest of my face and neck… one pad is enough. I also use a face oil afterwards to prevent over drying, use sunblock daily (you MUST if you’re using AHA), and eat a (mostly) healthy diet. I could not be more pleased with the results.Many people say they use these before makeup application. I cannot speak to that, as the most makeup I ever use is a small amount of tinted moisturizer mixed with sunblock.I used Dr. Dennis Gross AHA pads (which are $90 for 60) and these work way better, are less harsh, and a lot less expensive. I have sensitive skin and would highly recommend these.
title: Better than Dr. Dennis Gross AHA Pads (and cheaper)

text: Are you tired of looking at your dry, flaky skin every time you put on makeup? I was too until I came across these amazing exfoliating face pads. I was skeptical at first, but I gave them a try and I haven't looked back since. These pads work wonders on my excess dead skin, leaving my face feeling softer and smoother than ever before.Using these pads every other day has become an essential part of my skincare routine. My makeup goes on smoother, making me feel confident and presentable even while living in the dry desert heat. It's the perfect solution to my long-lasting skincare concerns. What I love about these exfoliating pads is how gentle they are on my sensitive skin. They do an excellent job of exfoliating without irritating or causing any redness, making it the perfect option for daily use. My skin has never felt more rejuvenated, and I owe it all to these amazing exfoliating pads.Overall, I am more than satisfied with my purchase, and I will be ordering the bigger pack to continue this perfect skincare routine. These pads have become a game-changer for my dry, flaky skin, and I recommend them to anyone struggling with similar issues. Don't hesitate to give them a try; you won't regret it!

text: Have been wanting to try this brand and the exfoliating products especially. Have VERY reactive skin and the best thing I can say about this product is that it IS gentle. However, so gentle it doesn’t “do” anything as far as I can tell. I have dry skin. I wanted to notice some mild difference. At $1/pad that I didn’t realize I was paying (thought I was getting 60ct instead,) I do expect noticeable improvement or at least sensation of such. This is a glorified astringent pad from a luxury priced company. I struggle to find products gentle enough that aren’t CeraVe or LaRoche Posay. Some of those are even too harsh. However, this product does treat me gently. It’s just that it feels and works about as well as water alone to me. I will use them up and not be repurchasing unless they provide some sort of commutative benefit—buyer beware.

text: A very good moisturizer for oily skin.  It is extremely light, sort of silky and does not cause break outs like most other facial lotions I have tried.  It is not at all greasy and I find that it quickly gets absorbed.  It has virtually no scent, not even when initially applied.  It looks like it has very few ingredients too, which I like.  As for negatives:  It is pricey for such a small bottle and I don't really understand the point of the eye dropper, other than the fact that the bottle is glass, so it can not be squeezed.  The eye dropper makes it possible to suck up the product and get it out of the bottle, but only a little bit at a time.  Also, the bottle is opaque so I can never tell when I am running low.  In the end, the product is GREAT and I do recommend it; however the packaging should be improved.

text: I can never say anything bad about Josie Maran  products because they truly deliver. I have been using her products for 3 years. I just turn 50 this year. People I work with were shock when I told them my real age. They thought I was in my late 30's or early  40's. Josie  Maran products  keep  my skin supple, soft and radiant. When I first started using the product I had fine lines around my eyes, mouth and lips that have now vanished. My skin is oily and proned to break outs. I initially thought who would put oil on their skin. Wouldn't it just  break me out more. Boy was I  wrong this product actually did the opposite. It cleared up my acne and reduced my oil.  IT is the ONLY product that I can use on my skin that doesn't break me out and keeps my skin  soft, oil free and radiant all day. Aragan Milk feels like silk going on my skin. Im constantly  touch my skin and amazed at how soft it feels. I use all off her products  from head to toe and will never  go back to anything else.

text: I like this serum a lot. I apply it in the morning following my essence toner and then again at night with a jade roller, and i really like the results I have been seeing this week. My skin has a nice radiant glow in all the right areas, but the serum doesn't leave my skin looking like an oil slick (unlike many other vitamin C serums, specifically Tatchas).  It definitely is not too hydrating for people with oily skin, but I also don't see this drying you out either if you have dry skin. The serum dries down fast... like REALLY FAST, but my skin doesn't feel tight or stripped after I use it. I also struggle with cystic acne, and the gentle green tea extract is great as a light exfoliant, while the chamomile extract is great for people with redness or sensitive skin (I have both!). This serum packs a lot of great antioxidant properties in a tiny little bottle for $62. I think the price is pretty fair considering how expensive Vitamin C serums with high efficacy usually are (e.g. Tatcha, Drunk Elephant). Hope this helps!

Label: Treatment
Name: Pure Truth™ Youth Activating Oil
Ingredients: Rosa Canina (Rosehip) Fruit Oil, Citrus Tangerina (Tangerine) Peel Oil, Tocopherol, Cymbopogon Flexuosus (Lemongrass) Oil, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Limonene, Linalool, Citral, Citronellol, Geraniol.
text: This product has done wonders for my skin. Before using this product, My face had a few dark marks from cystic acne and one 1.5 inch scar that was very red and noticeable. Almost immediately the inflammation from these marks reduced considerably, to such a degree that even my husband began complimenting me regularly (I hadn't told him I was using it, because I was working up the courage to fess up about the price!). I apply it in the morning and, because I have very dry skin, find the oiliness evaporates within the hour. It has a slightly orange tint, which seems to give my very pale skin a little color. Not like an orange fake tan, just a slight tint of color to hide the pastiness that usually presents itself around mid-January. If you have oily skin, however, you may prefer to apply it at night, in which case you couldn't enjoy the benefit of this color boost. I have never noticed a fishy smell, although my sense of smell is not very strong. I can say that I am a student, and none of my costudents have moved seats to get away from me or even scooted their chairs just a little bit away from me since my having commenced use of the product. In fact, people continue to gravitate toward me, which I can only surmise is due to my sparkling personality. Its definitely not the phone full of adorable baby pictures. Although my babies are really cute. in fact, perhaps my glowing complexion has slightly increased my popularity. It's tough to say, I was already pretty popular. And did I mention that I'm extraordinarily humble? Because I definitely am. In conclusion, the product is awesome, has improved my complexion to a noticeable degree, thus increasing my confidence, perhaps even making me an all around better person. Have a great day!Update - Still adore the product. Just want to point out that it can be purchased for $8 cheaper on Sephora. You have to pay shipping if you spend less than $50, but if you're like me and wait until you're out of several products before you finally stock up, that, unfortunately, isn't a very difficult obstacle to overcome.

text: Introducing our extraordinary lip mask that will revolutionize your nighttime skincare routine. Designed to deliver the hydration your lips crave, this remarkable product ensures you wake up to beautifully plump, luscious, and deeply hydrated lips.Crafted with a blend of nourishing and moisturizing ingredients, our lip mask goes beyond the regular lip balms or treatments. It provides an intensive surge of hydration while you sleep, ensuring your lips receive the care they deserve.Formulated with ingredients like shea butter, jojoba oil, and hyaluronic acid, our lip mask deeply penetrates and replenishes moisture, leaving your lips soft, supple, and oh-so-kissable. These powerful ingredients work together to lock in hydration, repair any damage, and create a protective barrier against environmental stressors.The convenience of our lip mask is unparalleled. Simply apply a thin layer before bed, and let the mask work its magic overnight. No need to worry about constant reapplication throughout the day. Wake up to lips that are visibly plumper, smoother, and irresistibly hydrated.Indulge in the luxurious experience of using our lip mask. Its velvety texture glides effortlessly onto your lips, creating a soothing sensation that relaxes and rejuvenates. The subtle, delightful scent adds a touch of indulgence to your nighttime routine, making it a truly sensory experience.Not only will our lip mask transform your lips, but it will also transform your confidence. Say goodbye to dry, chapped lips and hello to a radiant, moisturized pout. Flaunt your luscious lips and enjoy the compliments that come your way.Trust in the power of our lip mask to deliver the hydration your lips need. It's time to elevate your lip care routine and wake up to the beauty of plump, luscious, and hydrated lips. Experience the difference and embrace your most confident, kissable lips yet.

text: I bought this with the hopes it could help with a split in my lip from a year ago that just wouldn’t heal completely. It caused a hard spot on my lip that every time it started to heal it would start to peel and get hardened. It then would annoy me so I’d mess with it causing it to hurt again:( after using chapstick and moisturizing lip balms and never healing I decided to look into something more helpful.This product has definitely improved my lip, I was Leary at first because it didn’t seem to stay on, but apparently it was doing way more than I had anticipated. I kept applying it often and definitely before bed. My once split lip and hard spot and massively improved. I will continue to use this product. It also will last awhile considering a small jar.

I know it’s supposed to be for night but I use it during the day too.  The scent/taste is very light (which works for me).  It comes with an adorable, tiny spatula to use to spread on your lips, which I know is going to come in handy especially when I get to the bottom of the jar.This product kept me chap free on a recent trip when my lips normally get totally raw.

text: I really love this mask! This was probably my 4th pot of this, and while I bought the other 3 from Sephora, I found that this one is just as good quality! The product itself usually lasts me a year before I run out (and I use a generous amount every single night religiously), so while it is expensive for lip balm, it lasts a really really long time. I have tried everything from Aquaphor, Burt’s Bees, Carmex, etc, and this is the only thing that keeps my lips moisturized all day long without any reapplication of chapstick (and I live in a very cold dry climate most of the year). Overall, this is one of my favorite products I’ve ever bought and I highly highly recommend it!

text: first of all, this is my jam and this is my 3rd re-buy. first berry then vanilla and this time got caramel apple so leaving a review for that specifically. its not bad, smells definitely sweet, main issue is the color is orange tinted (like it shows in the photos, i didn't notice) so i found it less practical than the other ones. the color looks weird on me which is inconvenient because i like to pop it on before i leave the house or combined with other lip products, so i regret getting caramel! the clear ones looked so natural and healthier on me.these jars can last me like 6 months so i'll have it for a while and it's not terrible, just not as good as berry or vanilla. when i went to sephora i noticed the other sweet flavors like gummy bear smelled a little too artificially sweet to me too. just a warning for anyone on the fence, i'm just not always in the mood for sweet smells so if you're like me and trying to decide which one, i suggest vanilla or the original berry

text: So I purchased this on a prime special. My daughter had damaged my other more expensive one. It sat on my dresser in the box for months as I didn't think I needed it. Well, my skin dries out when I'm stressed. My lips were dry cracked and painful. The skin was peeling which I would pull off causing them to bleed. I said let me give this a try as I had nothing else. After one night my lips felt better. The second night I could no longer see where my lips were bleeding, and the third night back to normal. I know this is a sleep mask but I also wear it during the day. I'll buy other colors. I don't know what it tastes like as I don't lick my lips. It does smell nice almost kiddy fruity but that's better than the smell of those medicated ones.

text: Introducing our extraordinary lip mask that will revolutionize your nighttime skincare routine. Designed to deliver the hydration your lips crave, this remarkable product ensures you wake up to beautifully plump, luscious, and deeply hydrated lips.Crafted with a blend of nourishing and moisturizing ingredients, our lip mask goes beyond the regular lip balms or treatments. It provides an intensive surge of hydration while you sleep, ensuring your lips receive the care they deserve.Formulated with ingredients like shea butter, jojoba oil, and hyaluronic acid, our lip mask deeply penetrates and replenishes moisture, leaving your lips soft, supple, and oh-so-kissable. These powerful ingredients work together to lock in hydration, repair any damage, and create a protective barrier against environmental stressors.The convenience of our lip mask is unparalleled. Simply apply a thin layer before bed, and let the mask work its magic overnight. No need to worry about constant reapplication throughout the day. Wake up to lips that are visibly plumper, smoother, and irresistibly hydrated.Indulge in the luxurious experience of using our lip mask. Its velvety texture glides effortlessly onto your lips, creating a soothing sensation that relaxes and rejuvenates. The subtle, delightful scent adds a touch of indulgence to your nighttime routine, making it a truly sensory experience.Not only will our lip mask transform your lips, but it will also transform your confidence. Say goodbye to dry, chapped lips and hello to a radiant, moisturized pout. Flaunt your luscious lips and enjoy the compliments that come your way.Trust in the power of our lip mask to deliver the hydration your lips need. It's time to elevate your lip care routine and wake up to the beauty of plump, luscious, and hydrated lips. Experience the difference and embrace your most confident, kissable lips yet.

text: My lips have been so dry now that the heat is on at home. They’ve been peeling and splitting and it doesn’t help that I pick at them. I’ve tried so many lip balms that have helped so I was reluctant to try this but I bought vanilla because I was afraid the other flavors would be too sweet. I love this. My lips are better and softer even though I’ve only been using it for less than a week. I recommend buying 2: one for your bag and one bedside. It comes with a small applicator so you don’t have to stick your finger in and get it under your nails. A little goes a long way so it should last a long time. Highly recommend!

text: I really love this mask! This was probably my 4th pot of this, and while I bought the other 3 from Sephora, I found that this one is just as good quality! The product itself usually lasts me a year before I run out (and I use a generous amount every single night religiously), so while it is expensive for lip balm, it lasts a really really long time. I have tried everything from Aquaphor, Burt’s Bees, Carmex, etc, and this is the only thing that keeps my lips moisturized all day long without any reapplication of chapstick (and I live in a very cold dry climate most of the year). Overall, this is one of my favorite products I’ve ever bought and I highly highly recommend it!

text: I can't begin to add up how much money I've spent over the decades, just trying g to keep my lips from feeling and looking chapped.  This mask is a game-changer.  Not only do I wake up without almost immediately reaching for one of my many lip tricks, but the glorious effect lasts into the day.  I confess- occasionally I add a little bit layer in the day especially if I'm not wearing lipstick or a tint:). Best lip care investment I've ever made - and thanks for keeping me from wasting more money going forward.

text: After having my eye on it forever, I finally splurged. It’s definitely worth it if you suffer with dry lips, or just want something good for overnight. I’ve been a chronic lip picker my whole life, which leads to scabbing and dryness… this works wonders. The only other thing that has worked like this at all is aquaphor, and this is a little bit thicker. I’ve only tried the peppermint scent, and am curious about the others, but if you’re debating it, do it. With how long this jar will last, the price isn’t even bad tbh

text: first of all, this is my jam and this is my 3rd re-buy. first berry then vanilla and this time got caramel apple so leaving a review for that specifically. its not bad, smells definitely sweet, main issue is the color is orange tinted (like it shows in the photos, i didn't notice) so i found it less practical than the other ones. the color looks weird on me which is inconvenient because i like to pop it on before i leave the house or combined with other lip products, so i regret getting caramel! the clear ones looked so natural and healthier on me.these jars can last me like 6 months so i'll have it for a while and it's not terrible, just not as good as berry or vanilla. when i went to sephora i noticed the other sweet flavors like gummy bear smelled a little too artificially sweet to me too. just a warning for anyone on the fence, i'm just not always in the mood for sweet smells so if you're like me and trying to decide which one, i suggest vanilla or the original berry

text: So I purchased this on a prime special. My daughter had damaged my other more expensive one. It sat on my dresser in the box for months as I didn't think I needed it. Well, my skin dries out when I'm stressed. My lips were dry cracked and painful. The skin was peeling which I would pull off causing them to bleed. I said let me give this a try as I had nothing else. After one night my lips felt better. The second night I could no longer see where my lips were bleeding, and the third night back to normal. I know this is a sleep mask but I also wear it during the day. I'll buy other colors. I don't know what it tastes like as I don't lick my lips. It does smell nice almost kiddy fruity but that's better than the smell of those medicated ones.
title: It works. Helps heal dry chapped lips.

text: I tried this stuff a long time ago when a friend gave me her jar and I loved it.It ended up drying out to the point I couldn’t save it, so I went without it for years.I bought it again and missed it! It brightens my face up so much!It does burn when I put it on initially, sometimes brings tears to my eyes lol, but as it dries, that feeling goes away and it switches to a soothing feeling(I took a star away simply for this reason) I can see where all the oily parts of my face are as it dries and draws the oils out. It smells good until I wash it off.. then my nose has a remnant of some weird dirt and iron smell.. but regardless, this stuff does awesome things for my face as far as brightening, tightening, and cleansing.

text: First things first: when you open the jar, this product smells EXACTLY like Mountain Dew Code Red. Not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing, but it's certainly a weird thing.Anyway.This mask passes my ultimate (unscientific) test, which is to use it on a DIRTY face and see if it draws out impurities and leaves my skin feeling better afterward. This mask absolutely does -- it minimized my pores, drew out blackheads, made the skin on my nose a lot smoother, and generally left my skin feeling better than if I had just cleansed and exfoliated it normally.It is a little drying, so I use it sparingly and moisturize well afterward, but overall it does exactly the job I want a mask to do, which is to be a useful supplement to my normal skincare routine.

Ingredients: Kaolin (Australian Clay), Bentonite, Aloe Barbadensis (Aloe Vera) Leaf Juice, Terminalia Ferdinandiana (Kakadu Plum) Fruit Extract, Centipeda Cunninghamii Extract (Old Man’s Weed), Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Liquorice) Root Extract, Tocopheryl Acetate (Vitamin E), Undaria Pinnatifda (Kelp) Extract, Hamamelis Virginiana (Witch Hazel) Bark/Twig Extract, Punica Granatum (Pomegranate) Sterols, Garcinia Mangostana (Mangosteen) Fruit Extract, Rosmarinus Ofcinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Dehydroacetic Acid, Lactic Acid, CI 77491, Parfum, Benzyl Alcohol, Limonene.
text: This product is amazing. At first I was a bit skeptical about using it because I’ve seen it on Instagram so many times just scrolling through I thought it was just another product that didn’t work for my face. I have very sensitive skin. So sensitive that if I go out in the sun and I forget to put sunscreen on my face I get sunburned on my cheeks. No you know the say oh black people don’t get sunburned. Well it’s not true. It maybe because of my Asian side but my family is from south east Asia. And my mom never burns she just gets darker so I guess the genetics of bad skin skipped both of my parents and brothers and gave it to me lol. By that besides the point. I switched up my daily and night time facial regiment. And I’m telling you the results are amazing! Before I put on my curology facial treatment I put on the sand and sky mask. Wait for 10 and then my curology treatment and a moisturizer go to bed and let it do it’s magic. When I wake up I do notice a bit of an inflamed face only because of the detox in sand and sky. It only last for about a day. I will take the sacrifice because it truly gives my gives my face a soft natural glow! My friends even noticed the difference from two months ago! I really like how it gets rid of all of my blackheads! I used to have a lot and was not a pretty sight. But if you are willing to try this product out and are willing to sacrifice a day then it’s worth buying. I don’t buy a lot of stuff online because I need to watch what I use for my face because it’s prone to breakout at any moment. Plus everyone that talked about it on instagram already had clear skin! And I’m sitting there thinking well they already have clear and flawless skin why the hell do I need to buy this crap? It’s obviously not made for a person with my skin type! But I was wrong! This definitely detoxes the skin and closes up your pores. The only product that I have found to actually work with my skin instead of against it like many other products I have used in the past.I would like to point out that it is best to use it at night time before bed in my opinion to give your skin time. And in the morning you will notice a smoother feeling. At least I did. Can’t speak for all skin types.

text: My skin is glowing & hydrated better than anything else I've ever used. The smell is wonderful! Unfortunately I've gotten very skeptical & cynical about products that promise you so many wonderful things but never seem to live up to those promises.....HOWEVER, this product really does do what is advertised and I'm so happy with the results! I've been using it for almost a week now and I can absolutely see the difference in my skin. I had covid a year ago and one of the many side effects of it was losing most of my hair and having my skin age terribly. It got super dry, scaly & wrinkled and I was feeling pretty awful about the way I looked. Now, after just one week of applying this at night my skin has brightened up & looks dewy and smooth again. It's so soft that I keep touching it because I can't believe how great it feels! I will most definitely keep purchasing this awesome hydrating cream!

text: I have been used this mask for a few weeks now and I like it.The mask comes in the 3.3oz volume, as you can see from my first photo, it is a decent size. The mask has a dense and rich texture with a refreshing scent smells like a type of grass. The scent is very light, not strong at all. I personally really love the scent.I use this mask every night as the last step in my daily routine before bed. I notice my skin feels nice after applying, pretty much right away. My skin type is oily & combination. Even this mask is rich,  it is not greasy or sticky and so far it didn't cause any acne or breakout on me. The next day when I wake up, my skin feels smooth. I do think my skin likes this product and I have no problem to continue using it.

text: Over the years, my combination skin has always given me problems.  If I used moisturizer (because I usually needed it, particularly in the winter), I’d start breaking out.  Or, if I didn’t, my skin would be dry and flake off with my makeup attached.  I happened to come across this at Sephora and it had wonderful reviews, was reasonably priced so I thought “why not?”.  Best choice I ever made!  After my shower each night, I use my toner then use this on my face as an overnight “mask”.  I haven’t had ANY breakouts, love how soft it makes my face and has drastically helped with lines!  I’ve been using it ever since!!!  This is definitely my favorite regimen product!  Love it!!!

text: I noticed a pretty significant difference in my facial skin in the morning after this mask and that is why I think it is a good choice. It smells nice and was a soothing experience.  It did not leave my skin sticky or uncomfortable afterwards.  I am passionate about beauty products and know the importance of getting a product that works as intended and described.  I wore the Too Cool for School Egg Cream Mask for twenty minutes in the evening before bed.  The mask contains an incredible amount of mask essence.  The Collagen + Egg Yolk Extract is generous inside the packaging and on the mask.  I was able to use the excess mask essence on my neck, chest, shoulders, feet, and arms!  On some occasions, I find that I would prefer there to be less mask essence in the packaging but this has a pleasant smell and was beneficial to my skin. The mask sheet is heavy and I wore it while laying down.  This is not a mask that would have stayed on well in an upright position.  This is a hydrating mask and is a good choice for someone who is dealing with dull and dry skin. This gave my skin a healthy and well-rested look.  I appreciated that and think this is a good choice.
title: It gave my skin a healthy and well-rested look the next morning
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019

Label: Face Mask
Name: Egg Cream Mask Firming
Ingredients: Glycereth-26, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Cyclopentasiloxane, Cyclohexasiloxane, Glyceryl Stearate, PEG-100 Stearate, Polysorbate 60, Sodium Hyaluronate, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Dimethicone, 2-Hexanediol, Cetearyl Alcohol, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Egg Yolk Extract, Sodium Polyacrylate, Arginine, Xanthan Gum, Adenosine, Tocopheryl Acetate, Hydrolyzed Collagen, Albumen Extract, Ubiquinone, Disodium EDTA, Fragrance.
text: First, apply this in your bathroom. Yep, I know that may be obvious but I tried to apply this in my bedroom as I was watching the morning news ... and it was super messy. So, be prepared for a lot of drips as you attempt unfold and peel off the plastic mesh back.Moreover, the mask is kinda "slimy" so I dropped it twice as I was trying to unfold it. So be patient and definitely do this over a sink.Once I got the mask in place, I was able to smooth the potential drips onto my neck (rather than to waste it). After that, I kept moving my hands over the drips and onto my neck for about thirty seconds. After that, there were no more drips.I kept the mask on for the longest amount of time (about twenty minutes). My skin felt super smooth. While my pores were no smaller, my makeup applied really smoothly and then that made my pores look smaller. So, in many ways, this honestly works.Super nice for a morning treat or a bit of self-pampering! Give it a try! Recommended!
title: A Little Drippy, But Leaves Skin Smooth!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020

text: She's tried a few different mask products out of curiosity, most seemed just a waste of time and money, no real benefit compared to simply using some moisturizer or something and rubbing it in without the enforced 15 or 20 minute stillness...This one, though, she said felt better than most.  It was easy enough to get in place, and massaging it in was simple enough after time was up and she was supposed to remove it.  Not much at all left after that, it absorbed well.  She did notice an improvement and while she doesn't have huge pores to start, she said things did look as if there were some effect this time.For a single mask, price may be a bit high, but at least this one seems to actually DO something.

text: I'm not new to these sheet mask products, so I was looking forward to giving this one a shot. The purported benefits include pore tightening and moisturizing.The mask comes in an easy-to-open packet, and has a mesh sort of backing to aid in peeling it apart (this was appreciated because I've ended up ripping some of my sheet masks when attempting to get them out of the packet and unfolded). Unlike some others I've used, it is EXTREMELY goopy. It really does have the feel of being drenched in raw egg whites. However, once I put it on my skin it felt very nice. I left it on for the recommended 20 minutes and rubbed the remaining serum into my skin. Immediately my skin did feel moisturized and more supple. However, I did not see any pore-tightening benefits. Moreover, it was perhaps coincidental, but the following day I started breaking out around my nose (I do have sensitive, breakout-prone skin).Overall if you're looking for a good dose of moisture for your skin this is a good product, but at over $5, it's a bit pricey for a single packet, and those with breakout-prone skin should use with caution.
title: Does moisturize well; not seeing pore-tightening benefits
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020

text: I have psoriasis and very sensitive skin. As a result, I can't use most anti-aging products despite often being marketed as safe for sensitive skin. I have tried so many "gentle and natural" anti-aging products that have left my skin red, irritated and with new psoriasis patches over the years. I am in my mid 40s and happily give this clay mask a definite TWO THUMBS UP as my skin looks smoother, more moisturized, has more even skin tone and less wrinkles and without ANY irritation!!  I have purchased this product from retail stores many times prior to purchasing on Amazon-the prices and quality have been similar. Thank you DERMAdoctor for making this product without parabens too... Hope you will continue to exclude preservatives/parabens from your other products as well! Note: the eye soufflé and face cream in this product line did not irritate my skin either, but we're not moisturizing enough and tended to dry out my skin.
title: WONDERFUL Anti-aging effects for very sensitive skin
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016

I'm 48.

text: I really hate it when companies discontinue great products, and even though it cost a fortune, I loved the Epionce mineral sun block for faces. When I realized it was gone, I looked at the Coola line because I like their other products. Found this face sunblock for $32 (this could be 1/3 of the Epionce, certainly 1/2) and have used it for the past few weeks playing golf. So far, so good! I'm not noticing any color, certainly no burn. No irritation, and the scent is quite mild, only noticeable when it's first applied (IMO, and I'm pretty sensitive to scents). I really like that Coola has the Hawaii reef-safe designation, which I think is very important for all sunscreens, even when we're not going swimming in the ocean. As a friend pointed out to me once, even if you don't swim in the ocean, you go home and take a shower and all those chemicals wash down the drain and make their way eventually through the system, so might as well just not use them in the first place! Yes, it's more expensive using products like this, but IMO it's worth it. I also wear sun sleeves these days so I don't have to use as much sunscreen when I'm out on the golf course. Editing this to say that this product has avobenzone, which is actually not so great and may be banned in Hawaii by next year. Hmm. Guess I'll keep searching!

text: My go to sunscreen for my face. I have very sensitive, acne (cystic) prone skin. It clogs easily and is just overall difficult. I’m in my 30’s and struggle with my skin despite my best efforts. All that is to say that even throughout my treatments, Coola sunscreen has not interfered with anything and always provides adequate sun protection even when my skin was compromised. I love the application and there isn’t really any scent. For me it lasts beyond its expiration date and I do try to remember to re apply a bit if I’m going out in the sun more than usual. To me it’s definitely worth it’s cost but of course best if you can get it on sale since it is a bit pricey.

text: I've seen this product advertised and wanted to try to use it.  My skin is mature and I've been using it for 2 weeks daily 2x @day.  I do see a bit of improvement but as with most beauty products, I will need to give it maximum 4 weeks to see real improvement.  Then I will decide if I will repurchase.  It's not greasy and absorbs quickly into the skin.  The scent is not beautiful but it's purposefully not perfumed.  I'm fine with it as long as the product works properly.  Will update.

text: Excellent vitamin c delivery.  There are a lot of good vitamin c serums, sadly, some are no longer on Amazon.  This one is great.  I have bought the $74 bottles when I have wanted to shell out the cash.  You can go to other places and find listings of high doses, medium doses and low doses of vitamin c serums, lotions, and powders.  There are other websites such as The Abnormal Beauty Company which can give you a beauty regimen and tell you what you should be using and how much you need probably based on your age.  I’ve gone through them so I know what to look for.  You can buy from them or Amazon. You can find them also under The Ordinary.  They can be found cheaper on Ulta.  Some products on Ulta are more expensive.  It depends or Sephora. Just be wise before you buy, be sure you know what you need and then buy.  I’m not saying “don’t buy this product “.  It’s a good product.  There are good vitamin C products and ones you waste your money on.  They can be expensive or cheap. This item is $47.00 on Ulta.
title: Know what you need before buying

text: I love the way this product tightens my face and neck but leaves a white residue that after leaving it on my face about 10 minutes even though instructions say 5-7 I think I take a makeup remover tissue and wipe my face and neck to wipe off the white residue. It also says not to use your facial muscles stay expressionless for the time it is on my face which is hard to do unless looking in a mirror the whole time because you don’t realize how much you use your forehead muscles and muscles around your mouth. But after applying the product I can feel it start to tighten my skin esp to forehead and around my mouth and such a good feeling knowing it is working and after 10 mins and wiping the white residue off I look in the mirror and see a difference in the wrinkles and bags under my eyes. It says you can use as a mask by applying thick amount and let set for an hour before wiping off (don’t wash off only wipe with damp washcloth or face wipe) but I haven’t tried the mask. I still have bags under my eyes and some wrinkles to my forehead and around my mouth but has taken years to get them so only natural it will take a while using this product to reduce them to a point that I am comfortable with. This product has no smell and not sticky or gooey. When applying be fast because when it starts to dry it kind of rolls up the white residue and becomes flaky as it dries. But not bad. I would recommend this product. I use day and at bedtime. It also makes my face feel smooth and soft after wiping off the white residue. The only thing is I wonder when I wipe off the white residue if I am wiping off all the product. But since it is working I would say no. I would give it five stars but the white residue has to be wiped off after leaving it on and if you miss any then looks funny on your face esp if you leave your house to go to work or to the store. Lol. Also I have sensitive skin and it doesn’t bother my skin at all. I saw this product on TikTok shop and searched amazon for it and amazon had it a lot cheaper and with my prime got free 2 day shipping. I always check out Amazon before buying anything from another site because amazon never fails me even if it is a few dollars cheaper and with saving on shipping too it makes it a no brainer to buy from Amazon every time. Hope this helps.
title: This product does tighten my skin but leaves a white residue

text: I was pretty amazed to watch my "11" wrinkles literally disappear before my eyes. And it definitely smoothed out my face overall. However, the effects don't last long. And it gives your face an almost plastic appearance. It's hard to put makeup over it, as it just doesn't allow it to glide on well, but also mixing anything with it causes the effects to go away more quickly. I do occasionally mix a bit with my moisturizer and feel like it gives an extra little boost, but definitely nothing major like just using it on its own. If it would last longer than 20 minutes and work better under makeup (I have an uneven skin tone), I would legit buy stock in this stuff. I suppose if you have a 20-30 minute meeting or some family photos you wanna look younger in, here's your product. Lol. Bottom line, it works, just not for very long.

text: I bought this for myself to help slow the progression of wrinkles as I get older ....... BUT my mother who has been noticing dark bags and creases around her eyes and mouth has been wanting to try it out. She was hesitant because she has sensitive skin but I assured her that she would be fine. After persuasion, She allowed me to put this on her face and WOW within 30 seconds this stuff changed her appearance dramatically.  We couldn't believe how little we had to use and for how long it kept her firmed up for. It did not make her face break out in any way but it does leave a small little white residue. I do not recommend it if you are dark-skinned but if you have fair skin then you should be fine. She looked so refreshed and was so happy that she ordered three bottles and gave them as gifts to people we know with visible aging.  I will definitely be ordering more in the future for myself prevent wrinkles from forming prematurely. The picture in the review is of my mother before and after application. The firmness lasted about 10-12 hours.........  I was not paid or compensated in any way for this review. Just a very happy and super satisfied customer.  Also it's way cheaper than the stuff you see in the infomercials and works just as good. Make sure your face is clean and dry before applying. Also, you will feel the tightness for about an hour but you'll get used to the feeling and hardly notice it after a while.
