text: I tried this product daily for about 2 weeks.PROS: It does TEMPORARILY tighten the skin. I have Some deep wrinkles on my forehead and between the eyebrows. They completely disappear after I apply the product incompletely clean, unmoisturized skin.  The pores get tighter and I feel my skin get very tight.CONS: there are many!!!!1. The product leaves thin white film on the whole face and if there are any spots that ended up getting slightly more product, the white is very visible.2. When the product dries completely, the skin feels dry and sort of fuzzy or even like a fine sandpaper. Not very pleasant!3. The minute I wash the product off, or apply ANY skincare or cosmetics product over it, the tightening effect disappears completely. Not a trace of the tightness or smoothness4. If I apply ANY tinted moisturizer or foundation without washing off the product, it just cakes up and sits on top of the skin very visibly. Plus, the tightening effect disappears completely.5. If I mix In the product into my other skincare products, it has NO effect.So, in conclusion, I would NOT recommend this product because it cannot be used with other skincare and makeup products. So the purpose of it is solely to apply, let it dry, look at your smoother skin in the privacy of your home for a few minutes, wash it off and see absolutely no lasting effects after it. This product is useless, although the TEMPORARY tightening effect is there. I see no useful benefit in this product at all.pictured:1. Photo of the product2. Photo of my forehead after the product was applied and fully dried.3. Photo of my forehead less than 30 seconds after I wiped It off partially.So USELESS!!!!
title: It really tightens, BUT….
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023

Label: Treatment
Name: Instant Firmx™
Ingredients: Sodium Silicate, Sodium Magnesium Fluorosilicate, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Urea, Diazolidinyl Urea, Symphytum Officinale Leaf Extract, Foeniculum Vulgare (Fennel) Seed Extract, Panthenol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Retinyl Palmitate, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Phospholipids, Chondrus Crispus (Carrageenan), Disodium EDTA, Methylparaben, Propylparaben, Ethylparaben, Butylparaben, Isobutylparaben.
text: I’m Not sure what all the Debbie downers are going on about with this product because it is AMAZING!!I’ll just clear something up first off. I’m not getting paid for this review. I have heavy bags under my eyes and I am always looking for products to help with that. If this review helps someone, I’m happy with that.So, I was previously using a product called instantly ageless and I like this better. It works exactly the same way but you get way more product in this bottle for a much cheaper price! A box of 25 vials of instantly ageless costs $70. I would always try to make the vials last more than once because they were so expensive, but with this product you don’t have to because you have a giant tube of it!!As for the application process, here is my first impression.First of all the back of the tube says to apply on a clean face. 😒 I don’t know about you, but I’mNot going to wear this without make-up. What’s the point??I came home and started applying it over a full face of make-up because I’m bad like that.😈I tried one eye with heavy application, and the other eye with a light application. I ended up liking the heavy better for one reason only. (check out my photos) on the light application when I smiled, you could see the plastic face wrinkles that look totally unnatural. The heavy application side did not wrinkle at all!The bottom picture is the left eye with light application and no make-up, right eye with make-up and heavy application. The top left eye is my bare eye with no make-up or product so you can see I really do have eye bags!Honestly, I saw results every way I tried it.As for the white residue, I honestly can’t say what causes it. Sometimes I have none and other times it is bad. Since it was under my eyes I found that lightly dabbing around the perimeter with a wet rag helped and then I used loose powder over it. Not a huge deal since you are always trying to lighten the under eye area. Getting the tightened part wet seems to kind of melt it and ruin the tightening of it altogether so don’t do that.Pretty much it’s just like other make-up. You have to experiment and see what is going to work on your face. If it looks bad, take it off and try it again. It’s not the end of the world. Just don’t slap it on in a rush and get all mad when it looks like crap. You get out of it what you put into it. I really feel like if you have something like eye bags, it’s really worth giving this product a try. It’s not going to fix the eye bags (that’s a whole different story for another time) however, it may make you feel better about them. I have been insecure about my inherited eye bags for several years. Ageing makes them worse. Aside from plastic surgery, this is the next best Fix!****update after using for a few days***I have definitely had a few battles with this stuff over the past few days. Here is what I have found. If you are going to apply it over make-up only use a very light layer of foundation. Using concealer or anything heavy had catastrophic results. Also, I only apply to the area I want tightened. Smearing it all over the vicinity seems to cause more white residue. Using a brush is really the way to go. I think the white residue is due to Using too much product. Concentrate all the products in your problem area. I also believe fanning it is a bad idea. I used to fan my instantly ageless to hurry along the process, however I think fanning causes the product to have a cracking appearance that is hard to cover with loose powder. Be patient and wait the full dry time!I’m still working through the kinks and am looking forward to being able to apply this one time and get it right instead of three!
title: Play with it! It is pretty awesome!

text: This stuff is amazing! I am ,or was very self-conscious about my wrinkled left side of my face. My right side doesn't have this problem. I have been to a dermatologist and was considering Botox. I am not sure why my face is like this? I even had a brain scan to see if I had had a stroke, and no, I hadn't. So anyway I  had tried the eyelift cream made by this company and it worked great. I put a little of it on my face and OMG it worked, so I thought I'd buy this that is for your face and I am not disappointed. I am soon to be 67yrs old and have two sisters older than I am and neither have this problem, so yah, it was bothersome. The other day I went to lunch with one of them and she said what kind of makeup are you wearing? You look beautiful! I can't see any wrinkles. Well I told her what I had used on the right-side of my face, Which is called Tarte, but I kept the left side my little secret, well for now anyway. I can't seem to get my make up to blend in with it yet with good results but I've only been working with it for a couple days now. It looks even when I'm done even though I don't put make up on the left side. I do put a little powder on both sides, which I think evens it out. It lasts about 6 hours and when I go to wash it all off it still doesn't look real noticeable, but I can tell it's losing it's tightness. I have seen a post on here where people say it's not working, well here's probably why it's not. First of all before you squeeze it out of the tube give it a good shaking with the cap still on of course. I didn't do that the first time and it came out clear and watery looking. I put it on and thought, well that's not as good as the eye cream. Then I remembered I had shook the eye cream lol. So then I shook it and it was thicker and worked great. The consistency should look like vicks vapor rub. Well I hope this all helps you all. Took a lot for  me to even post that wrinkly photo of my face lol. Good luck.
